meanings.definition: To pull or draw along after itself.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was entraining the leaves as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent2: The train was entraining the cars behind it as it chugged along the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was entraining the other dogs to follow it around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The music was entraining my feet to tap along to its beat.
meanings.sent5: The river was entraining the fallen branches downstream with its current.

meanings.definition: To incorporate into a group or system.
meanings.sent1: The new student quickly entrained with the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to entrain the latest technology into their operations.
meanings.sent3: The chef was entraining various flavors to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist entrained different colors to form a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The coach entrained new strategies into the team's game plan.

meanings.definition: To synchronize with an external rhythm.
meanings.sent1: The dancers entrained their movements to the music's beat.
meanings.sent2: The heart rate began to entrain with the calming breathing exercises.
meanings.sent3: The pendulum clock seemed to entrain with the ticking of the wall clock.
meanings.sent4: The cyclists entrained their pedaling to match the lead rider's pace.
meanings.sent5: The metronome helped the musicians entrain their playing to the same tempo.
